body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following has the same final as the second character of the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 奶酪 nǎilào
options: Audio for 果汁 guǒzhī
Audio for 苏打 sūdǎ
Audio for 橙子 chéngzi
body.correct: Well done! 面包 miànbāo means “bread,” and its second character has the final “ao.” 奶酪 nǎilào (cheese) also has “ao” as the second character’s final.
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the word again, and pay attention to its second character—what final do you hear?

body.quiz: Which of the following is least likely to be the ingredient for the item in the audio?
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 汤 tāng means “soup.” We can add vegetables or meat into soup, while coffee is the least likely ingredient.
body.incorrect: Not quite… listen to the single-character word several times again to understand its meaning.

body.quiz: Where do we most likely find the item in the audio?
body.correct: Fabulous work! A 三明治 sānmíngzhì (sandwich) can be easily found at a local deli—maybe not in a Chinese restaurant.
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the audio several more times to better understand its meaning; then consider where you can usually find it.

body.quiz: What is the usual color of the item in audio?
body.correct: Wonderful job! 巧克力 qiǎokèlì (Chocolate) is usually brown, so褐色 hèsè is the word to use.
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the audio several more times, and then compare its pronunciation to its English meanings to see what characteristic you’ve noticed.
